answers.answer: are you taking any medication for anxiety?
no. my doc wants to put me on lexapro but i dont want to go on it
why don't you want to go on it? Anxiety can do so many strange things to your mental and physical health. I have Ativan 0.5mg that I can take 3 x a day if needed. But I also have Zoloft.
im just nervous about going on it.. im trying to tell myself i dont need it

there is nothing to be nervous about. I hate taking any meds,but I've found out that I don't weant to suffer anymore when you don't have too.It's just like someone having diabetes,they have to take insulin.As far as the popping you hear.I get that from my sinuses. Not so much in my head,but my upper nose area,and around my eyebrows.Maybe that is what you are experianceing.

None of us want to be on medication but for many, it's our only option.  You can try therapy to determine exactly what is causing your anxiety, which is normally a traumatic event from our past that we never dealt with properly or have even forgotten about.  If you learn what that is and deal with it, you can ease your anxiety.  But therapy can be a lengthy process and you have to determine if you want to continue feeling lousy while going thru it or take your medication so you can feel better. Never assume any new symptom is anxiety related, see your doctor to rule out other causes first.  You're trying to tell yourself you don't need the medication...but your body is saying you do.  Fortunately, we have a choice to feel better, the rest is up to you.

question: i have been suffering with anxiety for a while now and still struggling with the symptons that accompany it... but lately ive been having these popping sensations in my head that r really starting to scare me... does anyone else with anxiety suffer these sensations...
title: anxiety
